response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Valid Triangle\", \"description\": \"A triangle is valid if the sum of any two sides is greater than the third side. Given three integers `a`, `b`, and `c` representing the lengths of the sides, write a function `is_valid_triangle` that checks whether they can form a valid triangle.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_valid_triangle(a: int, b: int, c: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `a`, `b`, and `c` (int): The lengths of the sides of the triangle.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the sides can form a valid triangle, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"def is_valid_triangle(a: int, b: int, c: int) -> bool:\\n    # Check if any two sides are greater than the third side\\n    return a + b > c and a + c > b and b + c > a,\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_valid_triangle(3, 4, 5) == True\", \"assert is_valid_triangle(1, 2, 3) == False\", \"assert is_valid_triangle(5, 12, 13) == True\"] }"
